rComments: Wonderful professor that presented Linear Algebra in a fairly clear manner that really cleared up the convoluted book. Homework was a couple problems, but they can be difficult and take some time. Curves somewhat and is very fair.

I believe that Suh is a decent professor who did his best to be clear and helpful to students. Expected us to read sections of the book before his lectures, which help to clarify what was going on when he spoke. The homework was minimal but difficult so it took some time to figure out. Final was hard but curved even though he said he doesn't curve

I took him when it was his first quarter teaching. He has strong accent that makes it  hard to understand what he is saying so going to section is important. His midterm was fair but his final was extrememly hard, such that he curved the class a lot.

Do not take! His lectures , which are carbon copies of the textbook's lessons, are extremely unhelpful. You'll find yourself looking up how to do most of the material online. The material, which is not inherently difficult, is presented in a convoluted manner. He can also be condescending when students ask questions in class and in office hours.
